PERSONA:
sarah wilson is a 58-year-old white woman living in a small town in rural south carolina. she was born and raised in the same town, which has a population of around 5,000 people. sarah attended the local community college for two years after high school but did not complete a degree program.

for the past 25 years, sarah has worked as an administrative assistant at the county courthouse. her job provides a stable income of around $45,000 per year, which puts her household in the middle-income bracket when combined with her husband's earnings as a mechanic at the local auto repair shop. 

sarah and her husband mark have been married for 32 years. they have two children together – a 30-year-old daughter who is a teacher in a nearby city and a 27-year-old son who works in construction. both children have moved out, but sarah and mark remain in the modest three-bedroom home they purchased in the late 1990s after years of renting.

despite living in a relatively rural area, sarah considers herself politically liberal, aligned with the democratic party. her progressive views were shaped by witnessing economic hardship and lack of opportunity in her small hometown. she supports policies aimed at improving access to education, healthcare, and better-paying jobs in rural communities.

sarah's main economic concerns revolve around ensuring a comfortable retirement for herself and mark, as well as helping their children achieve financial stability. she worries about the rising cost of living, stagnant wages in her area, and the lack of career advancement opportunities available to young people who choose to remain in rural towns.

in her free time, sarah enjoys reading, gardening, and spending time with her two young grandchildren who live nearby. she attends non-denominational community events occasionally but does not actively practice any religion. sarah makes a point of staying informed on current events by reading online news sources several times per week.

overall, sarah's political views are heavily influenced by her background growing up and living in an economically disadvantaged rural area. she hopes for policies that can revitalize small towns, create more job opportunities, and improve access to affordable healthcare and education for all americans, regardless of their zip code.
